title: Where exactly did Columbus land in America? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: This map is busy, but it shows all four of Columbus’s voyages. He hit many Carribean Islands, but also stops in Central America and South America. There are probably good reasons for focusing islands, such as easily conquered and contained, good harbors, or water sources visible from the ships. Contrary to common teaching, Columbus never thought he landed in India. Using his sailor’s sextent he knew he was on the 20-degree N. Parallel, and he knew the Indies of SE Asia were also on the 20-degree N. Parallel. When it was later found out that he had located a new continent, the “old” Indies were renamed the “East Indies”, and Columbus’s Indies were renamed the “West Indies”. They are still called that today.

He did not land in America, a continent he had never heard of. Columbus wanted to go to Asia and he thought he had landed in the West Indies, as he called them, some islands close to Cipangu (Japan). Columbus never sat a foot on the American continent, but he attracted other explorers, which would then lead to the discovery of a New World.  Martin Behaims globe from 1492 shows the world of Columbus.

Many places, mostly islands in the Caribbean. That would include some of the Bahamas, Hispaniola (the island shared by Haiti and the Dominican Republic), Cuba, and Jamaica. The only place on mainland North or South America he ever set foot on was Venezuela.

It’s not known exactly where he *first* landed, but it was in the Bahamas. He landed in many places, to include Cuba and Hispaniola (modern-day Haiti and Dominican Republic). He made four voyages to the new world, but never realized that he had stumbled upon a new continent. He always thought that he had landed on the outskirts of Asia.

He landed in a place called Guanahani by the natives and was renamed San Salvador. However, because his maps were not quite accurate, it is uncertain exactly where, although we do know it was in the Bahamas Islands.
He never landed in what is now the United States of America. He spent all his voyages to the various islands in the Caribbean.
